title: Day in the Life of an IL Dairy Farmer #shorts

subtasks: Drinking fresh milk upon waking at 4 a.m.
Heading to the barn to meet cows at 4 a.m.
Ensuring cow teats are clean before milking
Attaching milking machine to clean teats
Observing milking machine's gentle pulsation
Milk collection into whey jars and bulk tank
Cool milk in bulk tank for transportation
Feeding calves after milking
Completing daily barn chores
Extra time spent with a specific calf, Gloria's red baby calf
Initiating milking process again around 4 p.m. at the end of the day

tasks.task: Daily activities of an Illinois dairy farmer
MAINTASK: Daily dairy farming tasks at an Illinois farm:
Morning milking and chores (4 a.m. - duration)
Afternoon milking and chores (4 p.m. - duration)

subtasks: Drink fresh milk first thing upon waking at 4 a.m.
Head to the barn to meet the cows, ensuring teats are clean
Attach the milking machine and operate it (gentle pulsation)
Collect milk into "whey jars" (as per instruction)
Transfer milk to the bulk tank, cool it, and store
Feed calves, particularly Gloria's red baby calf
Complete various barn chores
Repeat the milking and feeding process around 4 p.m.
